https://progressives.house.gov/_cache/files/1/b/1ba846e3-1cf3-44fa-a36c-bf7d8839a420/52FF9F683B3FB35BDA92458F0A59DE66.220729-cpc-tri-caucus-insulin-for-uninsured-people-letter.pdf
Congress must cap the monthly cost of insulin for all ‚Äî not just people with health insurance ‚Äî to save lives.

Excluding uninsured people from out-of-pocket caps would also worsen racial disparities.

Black, Hispanic, and Asian Americans have higher rates of diabetes AND are less likely to have insurance. 15% of Native American and Alaskan Native people with diabetes are uninsured.

Uninsured people with diabetes often pay over $1,000 per month for their insulin. They're roughly 2x as likely to report that they cannot afford their diabetes meds as those with insurance.

In the richest country in the world, too many people are dying from insulin rationing.

Congress is working to cap the monthly out-of-pocket cost of insulin at $35.

This is critical ‚Äî the price has risen more than 1,000% since 1999, a crisis for 37.3 mil Americans.

But right now, those savings won't apply to the 2 mil people with diabetes who don't have insurance.

NEW: Chairs of the CPC, @TheBlackCaucus, @HispanicCaucus, @CAPAC, and 73 House members are calling on congressional leadership to ensure caps on insulin costs extend to people without health insurance.

For the millions who are uninsured and have diabetes, this is life or death.
